org.prop4j

Class SatSolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.prop4j.SatSolver
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleSatSolver

    public class SatSolver
extends java.lang.Object
    A solver that computes if a given propositional node is satisfiable and retrieves solutions.
    Author:
    Thomas Thuem

        public void addClauses(Node root)
        Adds clauses to the SatSolver. Assumes that the given node is in CNF.
        Parameters:
        root - the new clauses (e.g. AND or OR node)

      • isSatisfiable

        public boolean isSatisfiable()
                      throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
        Checks whether the formula currently feed into the solver is satisfiable.
        Returns:
        true if the formula is satisfiable
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException

      • isSatisfiable

        public boolean isSatisfiable(Node[] literals)
                      throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
        Checks whether the formula the following formula is satisfiable. f and l1 and l2 and ... and ln Where f is the formula currently feed into the solver and l1,...,ln are the elements in the given array literals.
        Parameters:
        literals - an array of literals for which the value is assumed
        Returns:
        true if the formula with all assumed values is satisfiable
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException

      • isSatisfiable

        public boolean isSatisfiable(java.util.List<Node> literals)
                      throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
        Checks whether the formula the following formula is satisfiable. f and l1 and l2 and ... and ln Where f is the formula currently feed into the solver and l1,...,ln are the elements in the given list literals.
        Parameters:
        literals - a list of literals for which the value is assumed
        Returns:
        true if the formula with all assumed values is satisfiable
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException

      • isSatisfiable

        public boolean isSatisfiable(Node node)
                      throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
        Checks whether the formula the following formula is satisfiable. f and g Where f is the formula currently feed into the solver and g is the formula given in the parameter node.
        Parameters:
        node - a propositional formula
        Returns:
        true if adding the given formula results in a satisfiable formula
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException

      • countSolutions

        public long countSolutions()
        Counts the solutions of the propositional formula. If the given timeout is reached the result is negative. Since -0 equals 0, the output is y = -1 - x. If the output y is negative there are at least x = -1 - y solutions.
        Returns:
        number of solutions (at least solutions)

      • countSolutions

        public long countSolutions(Literal[] literals)

      • coverFeatures

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> coverFeatures(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> features,
                                                      boolean selection,
                                                      IMonitor monitor)
                                               throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
        Creates one solutions to cover the given features.
        Parameters:
        features - The features that should be covered.
        selection - true is the features should be selected, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
